definition: pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: As the sentence was read, she collapsed into her lawyer's arms.
sentences.chinese: 由于句读，她崩溃到她的律师的武器。

definition: to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
punctuation of a sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/period 句號|句号 and comma 逗號|逗号/sentences and phrases
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
